item.title: Is one type of water better than another?
item.description: It's hot and you're thirsty, so you pop into a store to up your hydration levels. In the water aisle and in the coolers, you're confronted with a plet...

item.title: Smartphone-controlled nerve stimulator returns golfer to the links
item.description: Avid golfer Robert Knorr found he was no longer able to hit the links last year, due to neuropathy in his legs and feet.

item.title: Too much vitamin B6 can be toxic. 3 symptoms to watch out for
item.description: Side effects from taking too much vitamin B6—including nerve damage—may be more widespread than we think, Australia's medicines regulator says.

item.title: Lung cancer screening could save lives, but experts say consider possible harms
item.description: There is much to commend about Australia's lung cancer screening program, which started on July 1.

item.title: Emergency department data show rise in hospitalizations due to pediatric clavicular fractures
item.description: Clavicular fractures are common injuries among children, usually due to sports-related trauma or accidental falls. The purpose of this study was to as...
